Ctor1.summary: Creates instance of AiLogger with configuration taken from configuration provider Provider is supposed to provide value for at least InstrumentationKey, Application and Component Provider can optionally provide value for Module, Role and Instance

Ctor2.summary: Creates instance of AiLogger with given instrumentation key and names of Application, Component and Module
Ctor2.param: Instrumentation key of related Application Insights instance to send logs to

Ctor3.summary: Creates instance of AiLogger with given instrumentation key and names of Application and Component
Ctor3.param: Instrumentation key of related Application Insights instance to send logs to

Ctor4.summary: Creates instance of AiLogger with given instrumentation key and names of Application and Component, and identifiers for cloud role and instance
Ctor4.param: Instrumentation key of related Application Insights instance to send logs to
Name of the role (e.g. computername the code is running on)
Identifier of the instance (e.g. in case that multiple instances of component are hosted on single computer)

Ctor5.summary: Creates instance of AiLogger with existing configuration object and names of Application and Component

Ctor6.summary: Creates instance of AiLogger with existing configuration object and names of Application, Component and Module

Ctor7.summary: Creates instance of AiLogger with existing configuration object and names of Application and Component, and identifiers for cloud role and instance
Ctor7.param: Name of the role (e.g. computername the code is running on)
Identifier of the instance (e.g. in case that multiple instances of component are hosted on single computer)

AddMetadata.summary: Adds additional custom dimension to be sent with logged events. Note that Application, Component (and Module) cannot be added.

RemoveMetadata.summary: Removes custom dimension previously added via

ResetMetadata.summary: Removes all previously added custom dimensions, so only mandatory dimensions remain (Application, Component (and Module, if used)) See also

WriteTrace.summary: Sends custom trace to App Insights, along with all custom dimensions associated
WriteTrace.param: Ad-hoc metadata to send with trace, in addition to mandatory metadata and metadata registered via

WriteRequest.summary: Sends details about processed request to Application Insights
WriteRequest.param: Human readable name of operation performed or request processedc
Result of operation. Typically Http response code
Whether or not the request was successfully processed
Url where request was received. Useful to log detailed REST API URL parameters received

SetOperationContext.summary: Establishes name and identifier of current operation, along with id of parent operation. This enables end to end monitoring across applications and components Information from established operation context are sent with telemetry records until removed via or changed via another call of
SetOperationContext.param: ID of parent operation (aka Parent Correlation ID)

SetOperationContext2.summary: Sets traceId and parentId based on passed value of traceparent http header value. Throws ArgumentException if value cannot be parsed according to W3C standard. For details on W3C recommended standard, see
SetOperationContext2.param: Value of traceparent http header. Method sets traceId and parentId as parsed from header value.

SetOperationState.summary: Stores traceState to custom dimension named TraceStace Meant to support W3C tracing standard
SetOperationState.param: Value of received tracestate header. Method puts it to TraceState dimension as-is, without any parsing

ClearOperationContext.summary: Removes operation context previously established via

ClearOperationState.summary: Removes previously setup operation state. See

SetUserContext.summary: Establishes name and identifiers of user associated with operation. This enables to use App Insights as collector of audit trail Information from established user context are sent with telemetry records until removed via or changed via another call of

ClearUserContext.summary: Removes user context previously established via

WriteEvent.summary: Sends custom event to App Insights along with mandatory metadata and optional ad-hoc metadata
WriteEvent.param: Ad-hoc additional custom dimensions to send with event

WriteException.summary: Logs exception to App Insights along with mandatory metadata and optional ad-hoc metadata
WriteException.param: Ad-hoc additional custom dimensions to send with event

GetMetric.summary: Returns instance of metric ready to be tracked with value. Metric namespace is automatically assigned based on name of application and component.

GetMetric2.summary: Returns instance of metric ready to be tracked with value. Metric namespace is automatically assigned based on name of application and component, and this command adds specified suffix, delimited from default namespace by a '.' (dot) char
GetMetric2.param: Suffix to add to metric instance default namespace.

WriteDependency.summary: Writes information about call to external service
WriteDependency.param: Name of endpoint (hostname or host identifier for server being called)
Name of the dependency type, such as FTP, SQL or HTTP
Name of the dependency, such as FileDownload, StoredProcedureCall
Dependency details, such as parameters of request
Whether or not call was successful
